load_data module¶

load_data.py – ETL: parse JSONL from the LLM-extended dataset and insert rows into the PostgreSQL applicants table.

Changes from Module 3: - Uses psycopg3 (import psycopg) instead of psycopg2. - get_conn() / ensure_index() / main() accept an optional Flask

app object so that tests can inject a DATABASE_URL via app.config without touching environment variables.

  • _build_conninfo() mirrors the helper in app.py.

load_data.clean_text(x: Any) → str | None[source]¶

Convert to str, strip, and remove NUL bytes that crash psycopg.

load_data.ensure_index(app=None)[source]¶

Deduplicate existing rows and ensure the unique index exists.

Used by main() before bulk-inserting to guarantee idempotency on tables that may have been populated without the index.

load_data.ensure_table(app=None)[source]¶

Create the applicants table and its unique index if they do not exist.

Safe to call repeatedly (idempotent).

load_data.extract_gpa_gre(text: str)[source]¶

Extract GPA, GRE Quant, GRE Verbal, and GRE AW from free text.

Returns a 4-tuple (gpa, gre_q, gre_v, gre_aw) where each element is a float or None.

load_data.extract_status(text: str) → str | None[source]¶

Extract an admission decision string from free text.

load_data.extract_term(text: str) → str | None[source]¶

Extract a normalised semester/year term string from free text.

load_data.extract_us_intl(text: str) → str | None[source]¶

Return 'International', 'American', or None.

load_data.get_conn(app=None)[source]¶

Open and return a psycopg3 connection.

load_data.load_jsonl(path: str) → Iterable[Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Stream JSONL (one JSON object per line), skipping malformed lines.

load_data.main(app=None, jsonl_path: str | None = None)[source]¶

Load records from the LLM-extended JSONL file into PostgreSQL.

Parameters:

  • app – Optional Flask app whose config["DATABASE_URL"] overrides the default connection string.

  • jsonl_path – Path to the JSONL file. Defaults to LIV_LLM_JSONL.

load_data.normalize_degree(x: Any) → str | None[source]¶

Normalise a degree string to 'PhD', 'Masters', 'Bachelors', or raw.

load_data.parse_date(value: Any) → datetime | None[source]¶

Parse various date strings.

Supported formats: "January 31, 2026", "Feb 1, 2026", "2026-02-01", "02/01/2026". Returns a datetime.date or None.

load_data.to_float(x: Any) → float | None[source]¶

Coerce a value to float, returning None on failure.
